title: Today’s the day when Boeing’s Starliner takes to the skies. Probably
summary: "The teams are ready. Boeing is ready. ULA is ready."

title: NASA and Boeing set for second Starliner test flight
summary: Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner spacecraft is ready to attempt another uncrewed test flight to the International Space Station, with both the company and the agency expressing confidence in the spacecraft despite past problems.

title: SpaceX begins installing new ‘Raptor 2’ engines on Super Heavy booster
summary: SpaceX has begun installing new ‘Raptor 2’ engines on Super Heavy Booster 7 after the prototype completed a range of tests and...

title: NASA puts ISS spacewalks on hold to investigate water leak
summary: NASA is continuing to investigate water that leaked into a spacesuit helmet during a spacewalk earlier this year and is holding off on future spacewalks until engineers can resolve the problem.

title: Military buyers challenged to stay up on the latest commercial space innovations
summary: Space Force Lt. Gen. Michael Guetlein said commercial innovation today is "outpacing the demand signal from the government."

title: Ball and Raytheon win weather instrument study contracts
summary: Ball Aerospace & Technologies Corp. and Raytheon Intelligence & Space will begin developing technologies for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s next generation of weather satellites under contracts announced May 17.

title: Kongsberg orders satellites for Norwegian maritime surveillance
summary: Norway’s Kongsberg Defence & Aerospace has ordered three microsatellites to keep tabs on vessels operating clandestinely in the North Sea.

title: Atlas 5 rocket and Starliner capsule return to Florida launch pad
summary: United Launch Alliance rolled an Atlas 5 rocket to its launch pad Wednesday at Cape Canaveral, moving into the starting position for a critical unpiloted demo flight of Boeing’s Starliner crew capsule. Unlike the first Starliner test flight, the spacecraft’s launch abort system will be armed during the climb to space Thursday.

title: SpaceX completes 21st launch and landing of 2022
summary: SpaceX has completed its 21st Falcon 9 launch of 2022, continuing an impressive average cadence of more than one launch per week....

title: Proposed constellations would enhance Arctic weather observations
summary: With Arctic aviation and maritime activity on the rise, Europe and Canada are taking the lead in developing weather satellites to gather global data and improve observation of Earth’s northernmost latitudes.
